commit.message: A couple of memleak fixes

format-diff.sh: allow passing parameters to git diff

Passing '--staged' is useful for formatting newly added files.
CPU: Implement __opencl_c_work_group_collective_functions

PoCL-D: SVM offsetting run to strip debug symbols

Seems llvm-spirv fails to recompile its own output if the result
contained unknown debug MD (likely produced with newer LLVM-SPIRV/LLVM).
Strip the debug symbols off for now to circumvent the problem.

Detect SPIR-Vs even if client doesn't have SPIR-V setup

Since the detection doesn't require llvm-spirv and the remote
can support compiling from SPIR-Vs, we should not enable the
runtime check only when the client has LLVM-SPIRV installed and
enaled.

This allows offloading SPIR-Vs from remote-only client builds.

Limit the max dirname further to avoid probs. with gdb

GDB seems to fail to load symbols from .so files which have
longer pathnames than 511, thus made the directory length even shorter.
Long directory names are produced a lot with C++/SYCL templated
kernel/function names.

Allow overriding the CPU driver vendor id and the driver version

For example, setting the vendor id to be 32902 (0x8086) and setting the
driver version using **POCL_DRIVER_VER_OVERRIDE** to
"2023.16.7.0.21_160000" (or such) can be used to convince
binary-distributed DPC++ compilers to compile and run SYCL programs on
the PoCL-CPU driver.

Misc. non-functional cleanups

...around the functional changes.
GH workflow: revert sanitizer configs from using Github-hosted machines
GH worflow: update to use GitHub-hosted runners for some jobs

commit.message:
PoCL-D: POCLD_COARSE_GRAIN_SVM_MAX_SIZE env

This can be used to limit the max size of the SVM region in MB.
Helps testing as otherwise especially the CPU devices can allocate
huge VM spaces.

PoCL-D vs. PoCL prefixes to log outputs and no newlines when redirecting

This makes it easier to combine server and client logs with
'sort client.log server.log > combined.log' and to get a readable
output: The timestamps order the events nicely and the headers
differentiate client (PoCL) and server-side (PoCL-D) logs.

PoCL-D: Fix the address parsing to not overflow

...when the ID is not given. This is to silence valgrind.
PoCL-R: Support for multiple remotes with SVM
Misc. cleanups
A test for multidevice SVM usage

commit.message: GH workflows: update some CIs to LLVM 18
remove old code
examples/chipStar: update to final 1.1 commit

pocl_devices linked list atomic access

utlist_addons contains additional macros for the list created using utlist.h. pocl_devices, accesses are made atomic where needed.

update doc/sphinx/source/notes_6_0.rst

Signed-off-by: Cong Liu <liucong2@kylinos.cn>

PoCL-R: Add VSock support to PoCL-Remote

This patch adds support for VSock communication to PoCL-Remote, VSock is a
high-performance, low-latency, secure, and scalable network communication
protocol that is ideal for virtualized environments.

Benefits:
    Simplified configuration: Offloads OpenCL computation to the host without
    the need to specify a destination address in the guest VM. VSock fixes
    the host address to VMADDR_CID_HOST.

    Reduced latency: Real-world tests show significantly
    lower latency compared to using a virtio network.
Usage:
    start a new virtual machine with -device vhost-vsock-pci option:
    qemu-system-x86_64 -device vhost-vsock-pci,guest-cid=123

    host side:
    //pocld -a 192.168.122.1 -p 9999 -v all
    pocld -a vsock:2 -p 9999 --vsock -v all

    guest side:
    export OCL_ICD_VENDORS=$PWD/ocl-vendors/pocl-tests.icd
    export POCL_DEVICES=remote
    //export POCL_REMOTE0_PARAMETERS='192.168.122.1:9999/0'
    export POCL_REMOTE0_PARAMETERS='vsock:2:9999/0'

Signed-off-by: Cong Liu <liucong2@kylinos.cn>

PoCL-R: Add ai_family parameter to pocl_remote_client_set_socket_options

This parameter allows to set socket options more correctly according to
the protocol, The order of the original setsockopt calls was adjusted to
avoid excessive use of the #ifdef ENABLE_VSOCK macro.

Signed-off-by: Cong Liu <liucong2@kylinos.cn>

cmake: Add ENABLE_VSOCK option to control vsock support

his commit adds an option (ENABLE_VSOCK) to CMakeLists.txt to allow users
to explicitly enable or disable vsock support during the build process.

Signed-off-by: Cong Liu <liucong2@kylinos.cn>
